title: Sonny Bill Williams offered £4.5m deal by Toronto Wolfpack to return to rugby league
text:
New Zealand centre Sonny Bill Williams has been offered a stunning £4.5million-a-year deal to return to rugby league with Super League-bound Toronto Wolfpack.

The 34-year-old suffered heartache with New Zealand in rugby union after losing the Rugby World Cup semi-final to England on Saturday, and was widely expected to retire.

However, having spent four years between 2004 and 2008 playing league before switching to union, Williams could now be set for a shock return to his roots in a deal that would make him the highest-paid player in the history of either code.

Sonny Bill Williams is weighing up a mammoth £4.5million offer from Toronto Wolfpack

Toronto Wolfpack would make Williams a marquee player, so only $300,000 of his wages would count towards their salary cap.

Williams, who has also enjoyed a professional boxing career and played for New Zealand sevens at Rio 2016 Olympics, is currently considering several multi-million pound offers from across the world.

Williams has earned 53 caps for the All Blacks, playing a role in the Rugby World Cup wins of 2011 and 2015.

Williams, who plays at centre, has won two World Cups with New Zealand in rugby union

Wolfpack owner David Argyle confirmed interest in Williams earlier this year: 'We are working towards making Sonny Bill Williams a Wolfpack player for 2020.

'We would love to have him join the Wolfpack family and we will pay whatever it takes to make that happen,' Argyle told Fox Sports in February.

'The excitement he would bring to the sport of rugby league in this country would be incredible.'
description: New Zealand centre Sonny Bill Williams has been offered a stunning £4.5million-a-year deal to return to rugby league with Super League-bound Toronto Wolfpack.
